required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate Endoflip Normal Ranges Data in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Normative EndoFlip Data on the Diameter and Distensibility of the Pylorus During Fasting and Postprandially in Healthy Females and Male Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to establish the normal range of diameter and distensibility of pylorus and the fasting and postprandial antro-pyloric motility in healthy adults.

detailed_description.textblock: An Endoflip catheter will be placed through the mouth into the stomach in order to measure distal antral contractile activity and pyloric diameter and distensibility during fasting and after the ingestion of a standard meal

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour prior to meal and 1 hour following standardized meal
primary_outcome.description: Change in Pyloric diameter will be measured during fasting and postprandial using Endoflip

primary_outcome.measure: fasting and postprandial pyloric distensibility index
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour prior to meal and 1 hour following standardized meal
primary_outcome.description: Change in Pyloric distensibility index will be measured during fasting and postprandial using Endoflip

primary_outcome.measure: fasting and postprandial distal antral motility index
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour prior to meal and 1 hour following standardized meal
primary_outcome.description: Change in distal antral motility index will be measured during fasting and postprandial using Endoflip

arm_group.arm_group_label: observational study of gastric and pyloric motor function measured with Endoflip
arm_group.description: observational study of gastric and pyloric motor function measured with Endoflip during fasting and postprandial periods There is NO intervention

intervention.intervention_name: Endoflip measurement of gastric and pyloric function
intervention.description: Endoflip device to measure gastric and pyloric functions
intervention.arm_group_label: observational study of gastric and pyloric motor function measured with Endoflip

study_pop.textblock: healthy adults between the ages of 18 and 65 with body mass indices between 18 and 35 kilograms/meter squared will be recruited for this study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Females and males.
- Between the ages of 18 and 65 years.
- Body mass index between 18 and 35 kg/m^2.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Heartburn, regurgitation, or symptoms suggestive of gastroparesis such as nausea, early satiety, postprandial bloating, and upper abdominal pain.
- Pregnant

eligibility.gender_description: equal number of males and females will be recruited for this study in up to 45 adults
